questions.question: This traditional Mesoamerican dish is made of masa which is steamed in a corn husk or banana leaf.
These translucent balls are produced from a starch extracted from the cassava root.
This spice, derived from the flower of Crocus sativus, has long been the world's most costly spice by weight.
This unleavened bread is an integral part of the Jewish festival of Passover.
This pizza from Naples is made with tomatoes, mozzarella, fresh basil, salt, and olive oil. It is named in honor of an Italian queen.
This character also goes by Mithrandir, Greyhame, and later, The White Rider
This is the author of The Underland Chronicles and The Hunger Games.
In the Harry Potter series, this is the animal mascot of Hufflepuff house.
Digory Kirke and Polly Plummer are the main characters in this children's book by C.S. Lewis.
Under this pseudonym, David Handler wrote The Beatrice Letters, as well as a 13 book series which has since gone on to spawn a film (2004), video game (2004), and Netflix series (2017)
This celebrity can be seen in a popular image macro, eating a sandwich with a downcast expression
This word was coined by Richard Dawkins to describe a cultural analogue to the gene
This slang refers to a particularly avid fan and is a reference to a 2000 song by the American rapper Eminem
Since it's creation by Matt Furie in 2005, this green anthropocentric frog has come to be associated with 4chan, Tumblr, the alt-right, and Hong Kong protesters
Founded by Dom Hofmann, this social media platform had over 200 million users at its peak. Twitter announced that it was being discontinued in 2017.
These two Massachusetts towns were the sites of the first battle of the Revolutionary War
In 1659, the General Court of the Massachusetts Bay Colony made it a criminal offense to publicly celebrate this holiday.
Later an American president, this man successfully defended British soldiers against murder charges arising from the Boston Massacre
In 1891, this sport was invented by James Naismith in Springfield, MA to keep his gym students busy on on a rainy day.
Massachusetts was originally inhabited by tribes of this language family, among which were the Wampanoag, Narragansett, and Massachusett
This painting from the Sistine Chapel shows these two human characters.
The name of this event gives the title to the below painting by Raphael
These two Old Testament characters are shown in this Giovanni De Min painting.
questions.answer: King Solomon and the Queen of Sheba

questions.question: The painting below by Rembrandt shows God's warning to this Babylonian king from the book of Daniel
This judge, depicted in the painting, slew Sisera to deliver Israel from the troops of King Jabin
The clip below contains singing in this language. The sample is taken from the 2019 album Map of the Soul.
The clip below contains singing by the artist Stromae in this language.
The clip below contains singing in this language, which is the most widely spoken language in Brazil.
The clip below contains singing in this language. The clip comes from a 2020 song, which is a favorite to win Eurovision 2020.
The clip below contains singing in this language and blends rap and traditional throat singing.
This Massachusetts town is the birthplace of Abigail and John Adams, and is a terminal stop on an MBTA subway line
